intro: Lotononis sutherlandii, commonly known as Sutherland's lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
